title: Video shows woman shielding child from gunfire in Pahokee
content:
PAHOKEE, Fla. (CBS12) — A man from Pahokee is facing charges in a drive-by shooting in Pahokee that left three people hurt.
The shooting happened Sunday evening near Adams Place and Rardin Avenue, in what the Palm Beach County Sheriffs' Office describes as a known gang area.
Witnesses told deputies the gunfire came from a yellow 4-door 2016 Ford F-250 pickup truck.
The gunshots hit a silver Jeep with several people inside and a red truck parked on the street.
According to the arrest report, video from an overt crime camera shows the suspect's pickup truck going down the street and gunfire hitting the two other vehicles. The video shows people running away from the gunfire and a woman sanding next to the Jeep, sheltering a small child from the bullets.
A person is seeing limping in the street after the shooting.
Investigators said the suspect's Ford F-250 pickup truck was reported stolen out of Royal Palm Beach.
Witnesses identified two of the three men in the pickup truck as being involved in the shooting.
Only one has been arrested. He's been identified as Ivy Love. He faces three counts of aggravated battery with a firearm, discharging a firearm from a vehicle, and felon in possession of a firearm.
